Checklist.title: Checklist
Checklist.description: Represents a checklist for pre-release testing production readiness.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Checklist entity.

ChecklistItem.title: ChecklistItem
ChecklistItem.description: Represents a single item within a checklist.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChecklistItem entity.

text.description: The description of the checklist item.

status.description: The status of the checklist item.

notes.description: Optional notes for the checklist item.

ChecklistVersion.title: ChecklistVersion
ChecklistVersion.description: Represents a snapshot of all checklists for a specific app version and platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChecklistVersion entity.

version.description: A sequential version number for ordering.

platform.description: The platform this checklist version applies to.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when this version was created.

definition.description: Collection of checklist versions owned by a specific user. Each document contains the full state of all checklists for a given version.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user.

params.name: versionId
params.description: The unique identifier for the checklist version.

firestore.reasoning: The structure is updated to store versioned checklists under a user's private path. This enforces user-ownership and data isolation. Storing the entire checklist tree within each version document simplifies queries, as we can fetch a complete version in a single read. This is more efficient than fetching checklists and items separately, and it aligns with the 'document-per-version' model requested by the user. Security rules will ensure users can only access versions under their own `userId` path.
